snippet: Religious works by Louis Comfort Tiffany are becoming secular attractions, achieving five- and six-figure prices at auction.
abstract: Eve M Kahn Antiques column; religious works by Louis Comfort Tiffany are being shipped from houses of worship to auction salesrooms and then to homes and museum galleries; Jeffrey S Evans auction house in Mount Crawford, Va, will offer about 2,100 antique glass sugar and salt shakers from estates of collectors Rudolph M Evers and Richard and Mary Ann Krauss.
lead_paragraph: Religious works by Louis Comfort Tiffany are becoming secular attractions, achieving five- and six-figure prices at auction.

headline.main: From Churches to Homes: Tiffany’s Religious Art
headline.print_headline: From Churches to Homes: Tiffany’s Religious Art
